member this.CreateVirtualDisplay : string * int * int * int * Android.Views.Surface * Android.Hardware.Display.VirtualDisplayFlags * Android.Hardware.Display.VirtualDisplay.Callback * Android.OS.Handler -> Android.Hardware.Display.VirtualDisplay
MemberSignature.Usage: displayManager.CreateVirtualDisplay (name, width, height, densityDpi, surface, flags, callback, handler)

Docs.param: The name of the virtual display, must be non-empty.
The width of the virtual display in pixels, must be greater than 0.
The height of the virtual display in pixels, must be greater than 0.
The density of the virtual display in dpi, must be greater than 0.
The surface to which the content of the virtual display should be rendered, or null if there is none initially.
A combination of virtual display flags: , , , , or .
Callback to call when the state of the changes
The handler on which the listener should be invoked, or null if the listener should be invoked on the calling thread's looper.
Docs.summary: Creates a virtual display.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created andÂ shared by the Android Open Source ProjectÂ and used according to terms described in theÂ Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the caller does not have permission to create a virtual display with the specified flags.
